[27-Sep-21 06:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	Welcome new Harmonians! There is a discord channel for Antares and Harmonia residents to ask questions and coordinate: https://discord.gg/vwcUJx8HHP


[27-Sep-21 06:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	One of the projects requiring coordination is the Chamber of Global Commerce (CoGC) which can provide 10% to 25% efficiency bonus in exchange for a weekly upkeep and a large upfront cost. This upfront cost is being taken of right now, thanks to cash donations from ANTS corp, lfabs bought from QWNE corp and electronics made by FIO corp paid with a loan from Deimos government.


[27-Sep-21 06:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	While a CoGC bonus can be applied to any population tier or any production sector, and ultimately will depend on votes (PRO required), the preferred choice would be to boost Agriculture by 25%. Most local production will benefit from it directly or indirectly (crops, basic rations, carbon, etc.). This is something than can be discussed on Discord (see link above) and you are welcome to add your opinion to the discussion.


[27-Sep-21 06:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	Lastly, the loan from Deimos government will have to paid back at some point. One option would be to provide the basic rations (RAT) for Deimos CoGC upkeep until the debt is paid off, which would be about 2500 RAT over the next 6-8 weeks (200k AIC total). With a +25% bonus on agriculture, this is reachable without additional costs if enough people participate. If you want to participate and have PRO licence, please reach out to me in the next few weeks to transfer the RAT and I will drop them off directly on Deimos. If you want to do it yourself, please notify Slomes these contributions are part of the Harmonia debt.


[27-Sep-21 06:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	For those without PRO, if you want to contribute locally, we also will need to provide for the local CoGC upkeep. And as we do not have an administration center nor a governor, we will have to contribute it by ourselves.

[06-Nov-21 07:15 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	By the same occasion, I will also announce I'm running for the governor position of Harmonia, now that elections are possible.


[06-Nov-21 07:15 AM] ApexChat#8127

[06-Nov-21 07:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	- capture tax money instead of losing it to Antares Initiative.


[06-Nov-21 07:16 AM] ApexChat#8127

[06-Nov-21 07:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mumzhar**:	- feed Harmonia CoGC


[06-Nov-21 07:16 AM] ApexChat#8127

[17-Jun-22 10:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SpaceGravy**:	Newbie here, just workin to get the basics of RAT/DW operation up and running. Would it make sense to aim towards buying an Incinerator and Material Plant to be able to produce OVE?


[17-Jun-22 10:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	It's good to stick to 2 or 3 industries so that you can stack experts. Incinerators are resource extraction so it's a good combo to have RIG's to pull water for FRM's to make burnables for INC. That's only two industries and C is in high demand now


[17-Jun-22 10:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Your 3rd and 4th expert add more efficience than the first two


[17-Jun-22 10:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SpaceGravy**:	Got it. So maybe add an INC for C down the road, but no need to go all the way and get a BMP when I can just sell the C outright.


[17-Jun-22 10:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Exactly, Also if you wait to save up for a base on Hephaestus then you can get their CoGC bonus of 25% for manufacturing, that's big


[17-Jun-22 10:35 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SpaceGravy**:	Thanks friend.


[17-Jun-22 10:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Any time

[07-Sep-22 11:45 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Sebaz9**:	Anybody able to answer a question ? Whats the difference between current workforce and capacity ? If I build another structure and bring the required workforce above 200 how do I increase that ?


[07-Sep-22 11:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
***userd2e0ced8cc** left.*


[07-Sep-22 11:52 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Sanggo**:	https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/tutorials/planetary-population/

{Embed}
https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/tutorials/planetary-population/
9. Planetary Populations :: Prosperous Universe Wiki
Prosperous Universe Wiki


[07-Sep-22 11:52 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Capacity is the number of beds available for workers, current workforce is how many workers are currently working in jobs right now. You increase capacity by building habitations, which can be found in the infrastructure tab of the construction buffer

[23-Jan-23 12:49 AM] ApexChat#8127

[23-Jan-23 12:50 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	may i ask a noobie question?


[23-Jan-23 12:51 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	how hard is it to be a part of a corporation? not sure what it entails


[23-Jan-23 12:52 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	Corporations mean nothing in this game, other than a shiny tag.


[23-Jan-23 12:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	In some cases, it is detrimental to be part of a corp.


[23-Jan-23 12:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	oh ok, one more question :)


[23-Jan-23 12:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	nothing is gated behind being part of a corp.


[23-Jan-23 12:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	A good corp will give you loans or grants and cheaper stuff and help you integrate into a larger production chain


[23-Jan-23 12:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	I watched a youtuber and he mentioned financial institutions and loans for starting, whats the logistics behind a loan in a game like this?


[23-Jan-23 12:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	You don't need to be in a corp to get fantastic help from other players.


[23-Jan-23 12:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	noted!


[23-Jan-23 12:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	each player has their own requirements on loans. Some have specific repayment terms. Some will give you cash to build specific facilities and then will either buy those goods from you (meaning you get the money upfront AND you don't have to take the goods to the market)


[23-Jan-23 12:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	some will want cash repaid on a schedule


[23-Jan-23 12:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	some will charge interest. some will not.


[23-Jan-23 12:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	also thank you for taking the time to answer my questions fellow planet mates.


[23-Jan-23 12:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	take note: there is nothing stopping you from taking loans and then just keeping the money and not fulfilling your side of the bargain. The lender has no in-game mechanics to force you to do anything. You're free to do whatever you want.


[23-Jan-23 12:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HeliumHunter**:	Of course, if you do that you make an enemy


[23-Jan-23 01:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HeliumHunter**:	You do not want an enemy


[23-Jan-23 01:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HeliumHunter**:	/ your reputation being obliterated


[23-Jan-23 01:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	*nods* id honor however if i decided to participate


[23-Jan-23 01:01 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	HOWEVER, it's worse than that. Many players (and all the big players) keep track of anyone who has broken a deal, either a loan or contract and not at least tried to come to some arrangement. This game allows a one to Block another player, and if you don't honour your agreements, you will find yourself Blocked by a lot of players.


[23-Jan-23 01:01 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HeliumHunter**:	based


[23-Jan-23 01:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	yikes


[23-Jan-23 01:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	Dealing with other players is arguably the 3rd biggest part of this game, after making things and sorting out your logistics.


[23-Jan-23 01:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	on the other hand, a lot of players (and I mean, almost all) are really nice and will want to help you when they can.


[23-Jan-23 01:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zean**:	well that makes me feel good! hah


[23-Jan-23 01:05 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HeliumHunter**:	If anyone wants to loan me 200,000 AIC i'll make em 50% share holders of a (figurative) gold mine I'm planning on colonising


[23-Jan-23 01:06 AM] ApexChat#8127

[19-Mar-23 10:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Burde**:	Hello, i'm new here, what is an expert?


[19-Mar-23 10:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**ChineseEarthquake**:	someone really good at something


[19-Mar-23 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zipatsu**:	Experts are activatable bonuses you can unlock after X amount of production time spent in a category, you can activate 6 in total (5 max for a specific production type though) for a boost in efficiency (production speed) in that type


[19-Mar-23 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zipatsu**:	https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/wiki/efficiency-factors/#experts

{Embed}
https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/wiki/efficiency-factors/
Efficiency factors :: Prosperous Universe Wiki
Prosperous Universe Wiki

**Syqel**:	A comma in Europe acts just like a period in the US without the appropriate 'Regional' option programmed into the function so I wouldn't necessarily call it a 'fat fingered' mistake


[05-Apr-23 07:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	It would still be considered a 'fat fingered' mistake as the term doesn't just refer to mistakes due to large digits but mistakes due to any kind of erroneous input from a person


[05-Apr-23 07:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Syqel**:	It's not erroneous input though if the person honestly thought a comma should be there because they live in the US which considers a comma a designation for the thousands

[29-Jul-23 10:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**caskman**:	I raised production fees, you can see the new fees at "LR ZV-896b".  They were originally 5 AIC across the board.  After seeing how much the fees bring in vs the cost of all upkeep I'll eventually be taking a loss of about 27,000 AIC per day.  So I've increased fees but a lesser increase on Agriculture, Food Industries, and Resource Extraction.  This made a lot more sense after looking at the fee structures of a whole bunch of different planets like deimos, phobos, promitor, and so on where they have much higher fees.

**ReganRotineque**:	In order to not be Unrated (U), your account must be Basic or PRO.  In order to not be Pending (P):      Your company must be a few weeks old     You must fulfill some Local Market/Shipment ads


[08-Aug-23 05:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**A.Nell.in.through.there**:	thought my account is basic.. isnt the free account basic?


[08-Aug-23 05:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ReganRotineque**:	FREE - never paid or bought PRO time


[08-Aug-23 05:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ReganRotineque**:	BASIC - have paid for PRO at least one time in the past


[08-Aug-23 05:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ReganRotineque**:	PRO - paid with time remaining or on a promotional license


[08-Aug-23 05:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**A.Nell.in.through.there**:	ah, ok. make sense, thanx


[08-Aug-23 05:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ReganRotineque**:	If I remember correctly getting a promo code does not upgrade you to basic when it runs out.   Only previously paid accounts get upgraded to basic.

**Senlis**:	I wanted to ask the local community of my planet on this: as a beginner player, should I focus on expanding production on an item I found very profitable, or diversivy production within my specialty (agriculture)?


[11-Aug-23 06:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**HamletsFather**:	depends on what that profitable material is. if it is something that just has a high and likely will drop in price again, i would go with your speciality. If it is something that has a rather stabel price or even is on a low and is still very profitable, expand that to reap the money.


[11-Aug-23 06:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**HamletsFather**:	you should take a look at the cx charts of antares and also of the other cxs at wich stage that product is


[11-Aug-23 06:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**HamletsFather**:	but generally: go with the speciallity of the planet, it is very seldom that profits outcompete the 25% production advantage of a planets cogc.

[20-Aug-23 09:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	Etherwind has a Resource Production bonus, so RIGs produce H2O 25% faster there.

[24-Aug-23 05:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rento247**:	Well, first, this is a sandbox game, so it would entirely depend what you'd want to do in the game. Maybe you just want to be foremost a reliable farmer than seek profit (though ofc with more profit you can be even more reliable farmer ^_^')


[24-Aug-23 05:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rento247**:	Second, even if profit is only in your mind, saying producing stuff is fool's journey is a bit overstatement imo. It's totally safe and solid way to grow in this game. But can you can make more money in stock market? Maybe, but there's defo risk involved, and there are companies that will take a stance against you if go too far with price manipulation.


[24-Aug-23 05:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rento247**:	But all in all, if gaining profit on purely just trading is your passion and you feel you want to take that journey, by all means, take a chance and go for it ^_^


[24-Aug-23 05:36 PM] ApexChat#8127

[24-Aug-23 05:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	There is no stock market in this game. It's all about "tangible" digital assets -- ie a commodities market. There is also a significant difference therein, being that most RL developments within most developed RL markets take a trend towards oligopolistic market domination, due to the sheer incentives that such a market arrangement provides to those who can dominate over all ther competition -- there is no such capability in here for a single group of players to thoroughly dominate a particular commodity market, aside from the liminations of a given workforce pool in an area.


[24-Aug-23 05:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	What you're left with is an open market, in which anyone can engage in pretty much any commidty market that they wish, at pretty much any time, with little detrimental effect, resulting in  what most would call an open, efficient market. Equity shareholding is largely non-existent, along with other modes of financial investment, as the game is simply not developed to the extent of analogs of what RL can provide as inspiration.


[24-Aug-23 05:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	The best resource that you can potentially hope to gain at this point is sheer information and experience, which will afford you enough  playstyle efficiency and gains to get you easily past the early and md-games. However there's nothing that will boost you above anyone else who's been playing this game long enough to be sufficiently in the late-game, as the sheer capital sinks, therein, are seemingly logarithmic.


[24-Aug-23 10:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
***TC5001** joined.*

[30-Aug-23 04:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	You'd think that, however there's significant discrepencies between locations that offer significant benefits (COGC + pertinent resource density + fertility) between industries.....


[30-Aug-23 04:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	Those discrepancies usually will incentivize the setting up of another base, specializing in a different segment of a production tree that you'd like to get into, however it comes with strings attached - being shipping capacity.


[30-Aug-23 04:30 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	Take Harmonia and Norwick, as an example. If you're only based on Harmonia, and have a vertically integrated farming operation, you'd only have to dedicate shipping for a portion of the time as export. If you decide to separate industries and erect a base on Norwick, you'd have to dedicate shipping about 1/2 of every week to keep Norwick supplied with agricultural goods, and Harmonia supplied with consumables.


[30-Aug-23 04:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	For those of us who did partake in those industrial shifts, we took the time and money to ensure shipping to those bases, one way or another. If you're just starting out, use the time to figure out what && how you're going to be doing things in the future.

[30-Aug-23 09:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	You have two large production buffers that aren't really noticed. 1) DW worlds like Etherwind, Boucher, Promitor, Verdant, Kinza, can easily be configured into HYF bases should RAT prices rise above a certain consistent margin. 2) Non-Agri COGC, water poor worlds like Phobos, Deimos, Electronica can easily be converted into FRM bases once profit margins of their relevant industries drops beyond a certain consistent margin due to rising consumable costs.

[01-Sep-23 10:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**RemboM**:	after running some numbers, a production force of 200 pioneers would seem to cost about 1.5-2k in upkeep per day. am I 'supposed' to try to get those costs down by making some of my own basics, or is that just the cost of doing business?


[01-Sep-23 10:06 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Whatever you make with your pioneers will almost certainly make several times that upkeep cost. So you can either sell other products, or make RAT/DW to mitigate those upkeep costs. It's sort of a "penny saved is a penny earned" situation, so you'll just have to do the math on which works better for you


[01-Sep-23 10:06 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	If you do make those basic workforce upkeep items, you will produce more than you consume, and be able to sell the extras


[01-Sep-23 10:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**RemboM**:	so I should not worry about bankrupting myself while figuring things out too much? ;)


[01-Sep-23 10:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Lots of people bankrupt themselves once (or twice!) and then COLIQ their company and try again


[01-Sep-23 10:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**RemboM**:	COLIQ? completely liquidate?


[01-Sep-23 10:13 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Yeah, that's the command you put in a new buffer to start over. Company Liquidate

**Figglehort**:	how exactly do you set up a new base?


[20-Sep-23 10:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Saganaki**:	Go to a "PLI" buffer for a planet and scroll to the bottom.  Click "START BASE".  You'll see the parts you need.  That's the parts for just the Core Module


[20-Sep-23 10:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Saganaki**:	"PLI KW-688c" for example


[20-Sep-23 10:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Saganaki**:	(After that, you'll need to construct the Habitations and production buildings)


[20-Sep-23 10:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Type PLI, hit enter, then type the name of the planet. I'm the planet buffer, there is a button in the bottom right corner for creating a base or seeing what materials are needed to create one on that planet.

[13-Oct-23 07:18 PM] ApexChat#8127

**TimeStag**:	i accidentally deleted almost half of the tiles in the trading screen, how do I make the buffers into permanent tiles?


[15-Oct-23 01:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	As long as they are affixed in the screen, they are permanent... unless you delete them


[15-Oct-23 01:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Hover your mouse over the gear icon of an ixisting tile, then use the - and | buttons to create new blank tiles, then drag and drop from the title of an existing buffer or other tile or type in the command for the tile you want.

[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Hi everyone! New to the game here. Just discovered this channel. Looking forward to contributing to the community.


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Are the 6 professions the only professions in the game or are there more?


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	The profession only determines your starting material, you can branch out into whatever other industry later on in the game so don't worry too much about which one you choose.


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Ah! Thank you


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Is there a moderating community on this planet or is it more like wild west/Eve online?


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	I'm wondering because it would be beneficial not to saturate producers for a specific profession where the supply significantly exceeds the demand.


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	The invisible hand is good enough at pushing people into the professions they need to be in through price signals, in the long term at least


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Naturally, however the market is not visible at the start of the game when picking professions at the start of the game to determine market opportunity


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	So I'm wondering whether the market i.e Commodity Exchanges are visible outside the game and updated in real time there too


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	There's a variety of products you can make within any of the starting professions and all of them have high velocity, so any of them are going to be fine to start with. At worst you can always open up a new buffer and enter COLIQ to start over


[29-Oct-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	I did not know that. Thanks man for the helpful tip. In my case I did find opportunity at the CX.

[17-Nov-23 04:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Does anyone else find it strange that one single company is creating artificial demand and supply at the Antares Commodities Exchange by flipping several commodities?


[17-Nov-23 06:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**krisjanis.liepins**:	May I ask what commodities are you talking about?


[17-Nov-23 06:50 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ragadais**:	It's not artificial. To make a buy order you have to deposit the money. To make a sell order you have to deposit the goods. It's actually a standard practice in real life, too (except in real life you can d oit without having the money/goods up front).


[17-Nov-23 07:26 AM] ApexChat#8127
**krisjanis.liepins**:	Another question from my side: what is "flipping"?


[17-Nov-23 09:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Flipping: Buy hi, sell low


[17-Nov-23 09:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Make money


[17-Nov-23 09:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	@sztypettto it's not strange per se, inasmuch as it happens quite regularly by players who have loads of cash


[17-Nov-23 09:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	But who aren't logging on so much anymoer


[17-Nov-23 09:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	I sometimes go through and "unclog" the DW and RAT markets, as it's really obnoxious to beginner players to manipulate those


[17-Nov-23 09:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**krisjanis.liepins**:	Buying high and selling low would loose money.


[17-Nov-23 10:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
***penwill1** left.*


[17-Nov-23 10:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	lol he got you there Domicius üòÇ


[17-Nov-23 11:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	oh is that what I've been doing wrong


[17-Nov-23 11:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	playing market maker is actually a nice way to make money, if there's a good spread and enough volume.  You buy goods from players at the bid price who need money right away and sell them at a slight markup at the ask later on.  The downside is if the price moves you can end up with a lot of a commodity you don't want


[17-Nov-23 11:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	The secret is to play market maker hardest on the things you can actually use so that if you do end up with too much then you can at least use it eventually no matter how long the price is low


[17-Nov-23 11:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	Playing MM also ties up A LOT of funds you would be better off using to expand your Empire. It's only really viable for those who have maxed out their bases and have a lot of disposable cash.


[17-Nov-23 11:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	it depends on what ROI you can get for your base vs. trading.  The less money you have the easier it is to get some nice returns because you don't have to worry about moving the market too much


[17-Nov-23 11:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	most profitable recipes that I've looked at (all the agri and food ones) have a breakeven point (the point at which you've doubled your money, basically) of maybe 10 days (there are some exceptions that are more like 7, and the best is 4).  10 days to double is pretty doable trading, if that's your jam

[26-Nov-23 10:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Hammond1983**:	alright, and thanks


[26-Nov-23 10:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	to give you some rough idea, the cadence of play for me is every morning I load up finished products on a ship and send it to market. I sell stuff at the market at the bid price, take the money I made and buy raw products to make more stuff with, then ship it back to unload in the evening


[26-Nov-23 10:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Hammond1983**:	probably the same outline ill eventually follow.


[26-Nov-23 10:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	you might not need to go every day, it depends on what you're making.  Fuel isn't free, either, so it's good to be deliberate with where you send your ships


[26-Nov-23 10:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Hammond1983**:	exactly how far will one full tank take me?


[26-Nov-23 10:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	it depends how much slow you're willing for your ships to go.  I can get from here to market with like 50 of each fuel if I'm willing for the trip to take a day.  If I'm impatient it can take 100s of SF


[26-Nov-23 10:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	you start with 500 FF and 1500 SF in each ship, which can last a long time if you weant it to

[27-Nov-23 08:18 AM] ApexChat#8127

[28-Nov-23 07:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Instead of us voting, make both candidates bid for their seat


[28-Nov-23 07:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Whoever bids the highest, has the highest stake on the line.


[28-Nov-23 07:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	We measure their performance with their objectives


[28-Nov-23 07:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	what if the candidates decide they want to raise the production fee to make up for the deficit?


[28-Nov-23 07:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	If they fail in some objectives, their wager gets deducted equal to the value of that objective, and gets distributed among the voters. If the candidate succeeds in all objectives, they get their money back, plus a reward from the voters.


[28-Nov-23 07:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Hernanduer**:	generally speaking, governors are also in charge of population management through POPI


[28-Nov-23 08:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Komalarn**:	Over the next year, there are going to be big government updates. Theres gonna be parliamentary government, not just a single governor. Also system wide government will be added


[28-Nov-23 09:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	The most important aspect of being a governor is taking on the responsibility of ensuring the COGC and Planetary Infrastructure are fed adequately to make sure we all have the POPs we all need.


[28-Nov-23 09:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	There is no way to make a profit as a governor; it's very much an enabler role, a charity.


[28-Nov-23 09:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	I find it personally rewarding, though you'll probably only ever hear from others when the wheels are falling off the bus )or during elections like is happening now).


[28-Nov-23 09:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	As for "accountability", there have been many, many movements to change governors who, for whatever reason, were not handling the planet correctly.

[28-Nov-23 11:15 AM] ApexChat#8127

[28-Nov-23 12:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**caskman**:	Weekly I make roughly 220k AIC from taxes but then pay about 447k AIC in upkeep.  I could profit if I more than doubled taxes again, but I make 350k AIC daily in production so it's not a problem


[28-Nov-23 12:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Also, if you don't have a governor, no one can run the planetary projects, which can be very cheap ways to tweak the population

[04-Dec-23 08:24 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DraconisDomini**:	Once you grow big enough you can move your processing (FP or INC) off Harmonia to make way for more farms.  If you go for consumables, move the FP to Norwick.  If you go carbon, move the INC to Nascent


[04-Dec-23 08:24 PM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Dec-23 08:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordeo**:	I haven't really begun to explore the various systems


[04-Dec-23 08:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DraconisDomini**:	Every planet has a specialisation from the Chamber of Global Commerce.  That gives you a 25% production boost to the relevant sector.  On Harmonia that is agriculture.  On Nascent it is resource extraction

[20-Dec-23 06:38 PM] ApexChat#8127

[20-Dec-23 07:02 PM] ApexChat#8127

[22-Dec-23 02:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	In business, to close a contract means to accept it. You're not the first to be confused by that terminology, however, as closed has a different meaning in different contexts.


[22-Dec-23 02:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	it's interesting because when trading stock options, "sell to open" means to create a new option, and "sell to close" means to complete the option and get rid of it.  So even in business it's not always consistent


[22-Dec-23 02:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ReganRotineque**:	dont get me started on the use of the term volume


[22-Dec-23 02:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ReganRotineque**:	it also has a variety of uses


[22-Dec-23 02:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	It might even be on purpose somewhat, helps create shibboleths to keep out the riff-raff

[03-Jan-24 10:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Jopgood**:	Hey @sztypettto! Thanks for the rec! I am starting out as a carbon farmer so I was thinking of focusing on building a stable production line for that. Eventually getting into liquid harvesting -> crop growing -> carbon generation -> distribution


[03-Jan-24 10:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Jopgood**:	I am also working on setting up some nice APEX screens to track the local CXLs and chart the commodities in my supply chain but i believe currently you can't design properly-linked dashboards? Like have one tile be the commodity chooser and then have all other tiles update based on this selection? Such as trade charts or inventories etc.


[03-Jan-24 10:44 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Comnyando** joined.*


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Glad to be of help


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	I would suggest not to become a carbon farmer


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	If you already have a carbon facility, use it to make carbon as a wrought product for something else


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	There has been an influx of new carbon farmers recently, as well as some old ones.


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	That's driving down prices


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	And all the good private contracts are secured


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	So you'll only end up into a bear market, slow grind, fighting for penny stocks


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Just saving you the headache and boredom from being in that position after a few weeks


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Regarding dashboarding, you're coming from an area where jumping all the hoops is streamlined.


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Can't have it completely like ERP


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Some hoops will exist


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	But one you personalise the screens and buffers to your fitting, it becomes second nature to switch between screens and keep your company running

[03-Jan-24 01:34 PM] ApexChat#8127

[12-Jan-24 11:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**polygonworkshops**:	Is there a ball park figure financially, before even looking at an additional ship(s)? Or other infrastructure milestones that need to be hit before even looking into it?


[12-Jan-24 11:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**polygonworkshops**:	and is there a point where you really suddenly see the need for larger/additional vessels? Do the newbie faction contracts suddenly ask for a little more? Or is that more a thing for after taking  Pro License and player contracts etc?


[12-Jan-24 11:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
***MysteriousWalrus** joined.*


[12-Jan-24 11:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**polygonworkshops**:	and, also is there a "meta"? Are a large majority of the playerbase all doing similar things - found a profitable production chain they like, scaled up, and now just basically farm currency? Or is it much more diverse than that? Thanks


[12-Jan-24 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FrooduBigguns**:	A new ship is going to cost you somewhere around 6-8 million if it has FTL capability. At least if you are sourcing parts yourself. I think you need a pro license as well to operate the shipyards. Once you are making a million every couple weeks or so, I would say that it might start becoming feasible to save up. Usually you will want to upgrade your starter ships first though. That can be done for around 3 million.


[12-Jan-24 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FrooduBigguns**:	Your need for shipspace really depends on your setup.


[12-Jan-24 11:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FrooduBigguns**:	The faction contracts never increase in size that I know of.


[12-Jan-24 11:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**polygonworkshops**:	Awesome thanks!


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**FrooduBigguns**:	As for a meta, there are sure to be things that are more profitable than others, but since it is a game about markets and selling, if you flood a market with a certain resource, the market price will drop. I don't play very competetivly so others could probably give you a better answer to that one.


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	the anti-meta is making IDC and selling it to the market makers.  There aren't any resource inputs for it beyond the labor required to run the building, and it has one of the best profit/base area ratios in the game.  But it'd also be pretty boring to actually run, since there's so very little interaction with other players


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	the ROI is also like 40 days (the building is very expensive) so it's a very late-game thing to even attempt


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**polygonworkshops**:	Ah ok cool thanks, so there are reasons to collaborate with other players/corps beyond contracts?


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	well, it's fun for one


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	in a way, you collaborate with other players implicitly when you buy and sell on the CX


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**polygonworkshops**:	I get the fun part, I was interested if there were mechanics etc that might incentivise it though?


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	there are projects that are difficult or expensive to do for one person


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	but in principle evereything you can do with a group you can do solo


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
***Kobold** left.*


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	Everything you can do solo is better done as a group.


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	There are many projects going that exploit the COGC & Experts system to maximize output for everyone involved in the Project. They're both profitable and fun, since you're playing this game with others.


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	As for ships: Before you buy a new ship, you should upgrade your starter ships. A WCB upgrade costs between 400k-900k (depending where you source & what parts you upgrade with).


[12-Jan-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	I ran 10 bases with 2 upgraded starter ships easily (all my bases were around ANT). I only started having real trouble around base 12.


[12-Jan-24 01:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Paris_In_Springtime**:	Lastly: Another reason to play with others (other than the Profit & Social aspect) is the fact that you can secure long-term contracts at reliable volumes & prices. Knowing the price of an input, even if it's momentarily higher than the CX, and reliable supply are worth more than the opposite.


[12-Jan-24 04:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**polygonworkshops**:	Excellent! Thanks guys! I have no desire to get another ship, just wanted a little context to general gameplay etc, great to hear! and thanks to everyone who chipped in :)

**Dangertech**:	So what happens for new players if all the plots fill up? Is another planet suggested as the starting planet?


[10-Feb-24 12:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	new players can always start on the planet, but others can't settle


[10-Feb-24 12:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	For example, if you look at ZV-759c (Deimos) you will see a +59 there.  If you go to the 'Start a base' and look at the Plots / available plots - its 0.  You can't start a base there until there is an available plot... which requires 60 bases to be removed from inactivity.


[10-Feb-24 12:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	New players can start there (and continue to do so) just that you and I can't start a base there.

[11-Feb-24 07:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jvaler**:	you can buy things by typing "CX AI1" in a new buffer.


[11-Feb-24 07:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jvaler**:	a production order is something made by your buildings. there is a production button on your base screen ("BS ZV-896b" in a new buffer)


[11-Feb-24 07:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jvaler**:	in that production button you just click "NEW ORDER" and choose something


[11-Feb-24 07:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Katinga**:	but it has to be something you have the materials on hand to make.  if it's a farm, you need water to grow something.


[11-Feb-24 07:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Katinga**:	a lot of productions require inputs


[11-Feb-24 07:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Katinga**:	but with this planet's COGC being Agriculture, farming something is a good choice.  Or run rigs to harvest water to sell off.

[11-Feb-24 09:04 PM] ApexChat#8127

[13-Feb-24 12:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	You are going to need some agri products.  Generally, these are made in a FRM (farm).  The tutorial contracts provide you with some starter goods.  If you don't have any agri products, you'll need to grow them (build a FRM) or buy them (in the CX - though note, if you are a farmer you should be setting up the infrastructure to grow them).

[13-Feb-24 12:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Then you'll be able to do a run of PPA in the Food Processor (FP building)

[16-Feb-24 10:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Lukie275** joined.*


[16-Feb-24 11:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	@DiStinkio (since Harmonia chat has more persistance than global help) ... Making MEA.AI1 is a long process that requires an advanced food processing building (the IVP).  I wouldn't recommend going all the way to that end.


[16-Feb-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Making FIM.AI1 however, is something that can be done with the FRM and FP that you likely already have.


[16-Feb-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	This would be done by buying DDT.AI1 at Antares and using that to grow HER (on a FRM) and then using the HER combined with a RAT in an FP.


[16-Feb-24 11:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	I do not recommend doing this until you know you have surplus capacity for making RAT and DW from your current setup.


[16-Feb-24 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	1 DDT => 4 HER is a ~2 day run and if you don't have enough FRMs to produce BEA / NUT / GRN (or whatever mix you use) for the RAT, you'll be spending money on idle FPs.


[16-Feb-24 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	The specifics of how many FRMs and FPs you should have before getting into HER and FIM - check that with Prun Planner.


[16-Feb-24 11:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	That said, I do recommend looking at it once you get to the scale (it isn't too many... I think I had 3 or 4 FRMs when I did my first batch) as there's a lot of AIC to be made when doing that additional processing.


[16-Feb-24 11:51 AM] ApexChat#8127
**bumm3r**:	I don't know if I'm doing something wrong, but every time I try to use prun planner, it just goes to a blank screen when I try to add a planet from the search function. Am I doing something wrong?

[10-Mar-24 02:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheRifleman**:	IS there any way to make sure that the recurring orders goes down the line?


[10-Mar-24 02:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheRifleman**:	like lets say if you have 3 farmsteads, have it produce 3 different goods?


[10-Mar-24 02:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheRifleman**:	Cause I noticed its a first come first serve sort of thing and that's slightly irritating.


[10-Mar-24 02:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	When a production order completes, the next production order in the queue is picked up.


[10-Mar-24 02:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	For FRMs, I've found that in general, if you set them so that they produce 12 items at a time, it takes about 24h to do that.


[10-Mar-24 02:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	So 3x FRMs and queue of 12 BEA (2x6), 12 NUT (1x12), 12 GRN (3x4) will produce the right ratios at a rate of about 1 / day.


[10-Mar-24 02:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheRifleman**:	Hmm interesting


[10-Mar-24 02:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheRifleman**:	I think I might make that a suggestion to the devs at the same time but thank you


[10-Mar-24 02:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheRifleman**:	there's an hour difference


[10-Mar-24 02:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**EnragedTribble**:	I do something similar for Carbon, I have 12 FRM and do 36 of each in 3 groups of 4 orders which take 3ish days and the 3 groups are staggered so one finishes every day an another starts. its MAI(x3) HCP twice (x9) and GRN (x9)


[10-Mar-24 02:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheRifleman**:	yeah it's just a lil weird


[10-Mar-24 03:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	It should do the same thing - the key is to have the same ratios of items in the queue.


[10-Mar-24 03:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	As long as that happens, they'll be made in equal ratios.

[11-Mar-24 05:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**FalconDestroyer**:	around how much is carbon worth?


[11-Mar-24 05:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**FalconDestroyer**:	nvm, I figured it out


[11-Mar-24 06:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	C.AI1


[11-Mar-24 06:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	(Which is a 1:1 conversion (at cheapest) from GRN.AI1 (along with the workforce needs and building deprecation))


[11-Mar-24 06:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	So you make about 400 AIC, less funds spent on RAT, DW, OVE, and BFabs for repairs.


[11-Mar-24 07:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	The INC will cost about 110 AIC / day for repairs - and 4 GRN -> 4 C is 1 day.  The workforce cost for 4 GRN -> 4 C is about 560 AIC (so add on another 100 AIC to the price of the GRN for costs).  So 650 operational costs for ~165 AIC on top of the ~250 AIC = 415 AIC costs... and thus the C is 200 profit per unit.

[13-Mar-24 12:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Motleykrube**:	So Shagie should I be growing GRN instead of HCP to feed into the INCs?


[13-Mar-24 12:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Correct.  GRN 1.H => 4G runs in 12h and is 0.25 H2O / GRN.


[13-Mar-24 12:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	The equivelent HCP is 2 H2O => 4 HCP in 12h ... which uses twice as much water.


[13-Mar-24 12:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Granted, we're dealing with "1 unit of stuff is half of H2O.AI1 price difference" - but that's still money saved.


[13-Mar-24 02:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Motleykrube**:	Awesome. Thanks for the analysis! I appreciate your information here and on the Discord.

[24-Apr-24 10:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Make stuff (primarily agricultural products here).  Refine them (it adds a lot of value) to either basic rations (RAT.AI1) or carbon (C.AI1).  Load them up on a ship and ship 'em to Antares station.  Sell them there.  Buy stuff you need, repeat.


[24-Apr-24 11:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Use that money to expand your facilities here and then eventually expand to other planets.

[25-Apr-24 09:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**_sashkaa**:	I found that refining it to carbon isn't worth it tbh


[25-Apr-24 09:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**_sashkaa**:	rather, you get more cash from buiding FRMs than building INCs


[25-Apr-24 09:35 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Exactly


[25-Apr-24 09:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	And that's the reason I stress that a number of players here mislead newcomers to make carbon and agriculture for them


[25-Apr-24 09:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	without realising that many of the players suggesting them are manipulating the prices in the market


[25-Apr-24 10:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	If you have GRN.AI1 ... C.AI1 is a 2x upgrade on sell price.


[25-Apr-24 10:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	GRN itself costs me 81 credits to make (cost of water, cost of workforce, building repairs)


[25-Apr-24 10:04 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	With GRN at 81, C costs 230 to make (4 GRN -> 4 C) ... and 81 -> 244 is 163 profit.  For C, that is 375 profit.  More than twice as much as the GRN sale.


[25-Apr-24 10:05 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Even if you price the GRN at 244, C costs 393 to make... and _still_ profitable to do.


[25-Apr-24 10:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Carbon is profitable to make.  How a particular setup compares with making RAT... that gets into some more accounting and trade offs.  RAT is also profitable to make.


[25-Apr-24 10:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	I'll also point out that the "is it the best thing to make _now_" depends on the prices now... and we also get into the bullwhip effect.


[25-Apr-24 10:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	(for a fun time, look at C.NC1 90 day price chart)

[26-Apr-24 07:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**_sashkaa**:	heyy hey


[26-Apr-24 07:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**_sashkaa**:	yes, but how much profit per day does an INC do when compared to FRM?


[26-Apr-24 08:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	A FRM growing GRN (and selling that GRN directily (note: 103 units of GRN.AI1 traded today) would make approximately 2000 / day.  Note that Verdant produces 113 per day for me.


[26-Apr-24 08:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	An INC adds another 1600 / day based on buying GRN at 200 (rather than internal costs) and takes 1/3 the space of a FRM.  In the same space as a FRM you can build three buildings that produce 4800 / day total _on top of_ the value of the FRM.


[26-Apr-24 08:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	There have been 5523 units of C.AI1 sold today.


[26-Apr-24 08:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	According to XIT FIN, Verdant (3 permits) produces 77k profit.  Frost (mostly INC) produces 36k profit on one permit.


[26-Apr-24 08:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	I am personally and advocate for diversification.  I've got 6x INCs going on Frost.  3x FER and 22x FP on Sand.  12x FRMs and an ORC on Proxion.  23x FRMs on Verdant.  The revenue from C and further product lines that use it is a nice part to my total revenue.

**RiseofFilth**:	Farms require a planet with fertility. Hydroponics do not. Planets with goodish fertility are rare. There are resources that only farms can produce. Therefore, it‚Äôs best to use planets like harmonia for farm-exclusive growing, and neighboring planets like life for hydroponics. And source water from somewhere, like Boucher

**Hal98**:	Harmonia has an Agriculture CoGC bonus. So producing fuel won't match that

[19-May-24 12:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Hal98**:	no worries


[19-May-24 12:58 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Hal98**:	CoGC is the Center of Global Commerce, every month we can vote on which program we want run at the CoGC and currently it benefits Agriculture.


[19-May-24 12:58 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Hal98**:	Experts naturally accumulate at your base over time as you run a production


[19-May-24 12:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Hal98**:	your base can have 6 total with a max of 5 of one type

[22-May-24 08:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	The market today may not be the market tomorrow.  See also the bullwhip effect.


[22-May-24 08:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bullwhip_effect

{Embed}
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bullwhip_effect
Bullwhip effect
The bullwhip effect is a supply chain phenomenon where orders to suppliers tend to have a larger variability than sales to buyers, which results in an amplified demand variability upstream. In part, this results in increasing swings in inventory in response to shifts in consumer demand as one moves further up the supply chain. The concept first ...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/Tiv1c4WXvOACiM5WQuazdXgdbBGFXWgu9Ri79NC8ljk/https/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7f/Bullwhip_effect.png


[22-May-24 08:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Over time, diversify.  Don't make a "do everything" base because that base will have very low margins (or even costs more to make the goods than you can buy them for on the CX).


[22-May-24 08:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	Use Prun Planner to identify what the costs for production are - and what the current (!) best products to make are.

[12-Jun-24 08:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Saxi**:	dang how is influence calculated?


[12-Jun-24 09:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	For COGC voting, it is a weighted by workforce tier.  PIO have 1 influence.  I have 800 PIO working here, so I have 800 influence on COGC voting.


[12-Jun-24 09:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	For gov voting, its 1 player 1 vote - I have one vote to cast for gov.


[12-Jun-24 09:13 AM] ApexChat#8127
**shagie**:	I will point out that for gov on a starter world it can be necessary to let the planet's POPI / COGC "borrow" money from you from time to time.  Verdant has owed me up to 250k NCC at one point.  Right now, Verdant only owes me 32k NCC.  Being able to have sufficient liquidity to be able to cover that on a week to week basis is important for starter world.

Home on Lagrange (The L5 Song)
"Home on Lagrange (The L5 Song)" is a filk song, written in 1977 by William S. Higgins and Barry D. Gehm, intended to be sung to the tune of Home on the Range. It was inspired by the idea of placing large, self-contained space colonies into stable equilibrium at the L4 or L5 Lagrange points, which had been advocated by Gerard O'Neill.  The song'...

Without luxuries like COF and PWO the pioneers will work at reduced efficiency (of 79%). Only with luxuries do they get to 100%.

[22-Jun-24 12:07 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	For pioneers there are 230k employed on the planet, with an unemployment rate of 9%, so the reserve pool is 20k, give or take. If you were to build a farm (BBC ZV-896b), you see "Pioneers 50 (2090)". That means out of the 50 you need, 2090 are readily available for instant allocation. If you overdraw by wanting to build something more high tech, like an in vitro plant IVP, those numbers are "Technicians 70 (20)". So out of the 70 you‚Äôd need, only 20 would be filled. Incidentally, there are only 540 TEC on Harmonia, and 40% of those are unemployed (216 people), which with the 10% instant allocation factor (so one person can‚Äôt hog all unemployed for their base) builds up to the 20 TEC available for the IVP in the example.

[23-Jun-24 12:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Arctarus**:	What are these planetary exploration surveys I keep getting contracts for?


[23-Jun-24 12:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**EnemyCube**:	You'll continually get faction missions which may have useful rewards. the exploration survey ones are basically never worth doing though


[23-Jun-24 12:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	They are tasks where you take your ship, fly it to that planet, land on it, fulfill that survey request, and depart again. Don‚Äôt forget the hitting fulfill part, that is essential.


[23-Jun-24 12:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	What you can do is hoard all the survey missions that don‚Äôt have a timer (see "due" column being empty) and try to see if you‚Äôll get a matching pair.


[23-Jun-24 12:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	Might take a while, though.


[23-Jun-24 12:46 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	Incidentally, if you accumulate two survey quests for the same system, check the flight times from planet x to planet y beforehand. Due to orbital mechanics there‚Äôs a moderate chance that flying out of the system and jumping back in in much cheaper in fuel  and/or time.


[23-Jun-24 12:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Arctarus**:	They all are for different systems. A few of them don't have deadlines though.


[23-Jun-24 12:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Arctarus**:	They award 4.5-5k AIC. Seems like it could be decent since I just started


[23-Jun-24 12:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**EnemyCube**:	look at how much fuel it'll take to get there and back though, and calculate the cost


[23-Jun-24 12:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	It‚Äôs _usually_ not worth the cost to do survey missions (rule of thumb, fuel costs about 15¬±1 AIC per unit), buuuuuuut I like to collect the ones without deadlines. I like to see them gather dust in idle.


[23-Jun-24 12:56 PM] ApexChat#8127

[07-Aug-24 05:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**saletroo**:	Hi, how to increase max experts for base?


[07-Aug-24 06:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Azean**:	Heya, you can not increase the max experts number. You can not have more than 6 active experts on one planet and you can not have more than 5 active experts in a category. There is no way to increase those limits. The amount of experts themselves slowly rises if you have active production for their category.


[07-Aug-24 07:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Azean**:	Those limits are per planet.

[18-Aug-24 08:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	You lose faction reputation, and if you picked up the shipment, it would unwrap to whatever it is. Almost by guarantee less worth than the shipping contract.


[18-Aug-24 08:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	For these shipping contracts it always pays (in this case literally ;) ) to check who and where. "Provision" means whoever is in that row supplies stuff, and "partner" means the other side of the contract.


[18-Aug-24 08:26 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	So for instance if the contract says something like "provision 100 units of RAT at Harmonia" and the party column lists is empty it means you are the one providing the 100 units.


[18-Aug-24 08:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	In contrast if it says "provisioning shipment @ Harmonia" it means the partner provides a shipment at that location, you pick it up there, deliver it to wherever it says in the contract (the CX for instance), and then you also need to hit FULFIL on the contract.


[18-Aug-24 08:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Geraldivar**:	You don't need to have storage or a warehouse at the delivery location, the partner takes care of that.

[21-Aug-24 10:01 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	@KittensAttack, one way to measure market activity is to follow the chart. The CX does not represent the entirety of any commodity's market activity. Plenty of insider trading and private contracts happen. If you're listing your FIM, check with listed buyers and chat with people buying FIM to understand their buying needs. The market works based on market forces. Of course the element that books leave out is corruption, collusion, manipulation, scams, frauds etc. Fortunately scams and fraud have been minimised greatly in PU. But the other elements remain.


[21-Aug-24 10:01 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Diversify what you can sell


[21-Aug-24 10:01 AM] ApexChat#8127
**sztypettto**:	Don't stick with one commodity


[21-Aug-24 10:03 AM] ApexChat#8127

**Turlorn**:	CAF, HER and MTP are intermediate steps for more expensive products. they are very difficult to buy since they are all directly used for hte next production step. if you are lucky you can buy some surplus production.

[30-Dec-24 09:45 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Frentic**:	The real reason is cost. Each 2 warehouse levels give 500 more in space. Each warehouse level is around 1mi. Finance-wise, Harmonia is running really low on taxes so the government income is 300k per week. Would take ~4 weeks with current tax levels to increase 1 warehouse level.


[30-Dec-24 09:46 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Frentic**:	To go from level 9 (Harmonia) to lvl 15 (Proxion) ... would take a lot of time or require increased taxes. Good thing we have great governor/parliament/residents who are willing to donate the mats.

[30-Dec-24 12:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Frentic**:	@SanityCat: Planets are never managed to profit, but to pay its bills and get better infrastructure. For that to happen, either we donate (which is what the majority of governors do), or we tax accordingly to have . Taxes are used to balance costs and improvements, so we aim to have a good weekly surplus (what you would call profit). Here in Harmonia, however, the surplus is really low to be able to consider using it for planetary infrastructure improvements.


[30-Dec-24 12:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Frentic**:	But that doesn't stop us when someone asks for improvements... theres also great ppl who bundle together and donate these improvements. If you want to participate just let us know o7

**IIZard**:	Just build a rig and pump it yourself?


[04-Jan-25 01:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Tanda**:	While that's possible here, it's not optimal. Harmonia has low enough water concentration that it's more profitable to just import water and run straight farms here


[04-Jan-25 01:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Tanda**:	I don't run any Rigs on the planet, I just import a shipload of water every now and then


[04-Jan-25 02:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**IIZard**:	You're probably big enough where that min/max is important? But for smaller players, pumping that water might be worth the cost


[04-Jan-25 02:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Tanda**:	minmaxing is actually more important for smaller players. My operation is big enough I can afford to cut margin here and there

**jvaler**:	it's just better overall

[04-Jan-25 05:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jvaler**:	so there's no added logistical cost to importing water
